Interface ec.id.CapabilityReceiptInterface

Implementing Classes:
CapabilityReceipt
public abstract interface CapabilityReceiptInterface
Interface defining contract that any capability receipt must satisfy. This defines the methods that the Identity and IdentityOwner classes expect the CapabilityReceipt (of any type) to satisfy.

Author:
Scott B. Lewis, slewis@communities.com

Method Summary
Object getCapability(IdentityOwner owner)
          If "ownerTag" matches the tag given at creation of this receipt, then return the capability.
void notifyReceiverOfCapability()
          Actually notify CapabilityReceiver of the arrival of the new capability.
void setCapability(Object capability)
          Allow the receiver to specify the capability for this receipt.
 

Method Detail

getCapability

public Object getCapability(IdentityOwner owner)
If "ownerTag" matches the tag given at creation of this receipt, then return the capability. Otherwise return null. This method is final so noone can override it and steal owner tags.
Parameters:
ownerTag - the IdentityOwner that is responsible for this receipt
Returns:
Object that is the capability, null is returned if the ownertag is not right, or the capability itself is actually null.

setCapability

public void setCapability(Object capability)
                  throws Exception
Allow the receiver to specify the capability for this receipt. This lets the 'requestee' specify the capability intended for the receiver. The 'requestee' should send this message *before* the Identity.giveCapability message is sent so that when the requester gets the giveCapability message it can respond to it by redeeming the receipt.

NOTE: This is the method called by Identity.giveCapability that is responsible for actually setting the capability for this receipt. It is declared package protected, so code outside the identity package cannot call it.

Parameters:
capability - the Object that is the capability to be provided to the requester

notifyReceiverOfCapability

public void notifyReceiverOfCapability()
Actually notify CapabilityReceiver of the arrival of the new capability. Present so that subclasses that define setCapability() can use this method to notify the CapabilityReceiver of the actual arrival of the capability.

Package protected so that only the IdentityOwner.deliverCapbility code can call this method.
